author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahācundo cetīsu viharati sahajātiyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the land of the Cetis at Sahajāti.

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahācundo bhikkhū āmantesi:
“Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahācundassa paccassosuṃ.

segments.en: “Reverends, a mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge says:
‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.

segments.pli: nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
A mendicant who makes a declaration of development says:
‘I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.

segments.pli: nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
A mendicant who makes a declaration of both knowledge and development says:

segments.pli: ‘jānāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, passāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, bhāvitakāyomhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño’ti.
segments.en: ‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching. And I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.

segments.pli: nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, puriso daliddova samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeyya, adhanova samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeyya, abhogova samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: Suppose a poor, needy, and penniless person was to declare themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.

segments.pli: So kismiñcideva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne na sakkuṇeyya upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā.
segments.en: But when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.
Then they would know of them:

segments.pli: ‘daliddova ayamāyasmā samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeti, adhanova ayamāyasmā samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeti, abhogavāva ayamāyasmā samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeti.
segments.en: ‘This person declares themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy, but they are in fact poor, penniless, and needy.’

segments.pli: Tathā hi ayamāyasmā kismiñcideva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne na sakkoti upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā’ti.
segments.en: Because when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, ñāṇavādañca bhikkhu vadamāno bhāvanāvādañca:
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge and development says:

segments.pli: ‘jānāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, passāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, bhāvitakāyomhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño’ti.
segments.en: ‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching. And I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.

segments.pli: nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
A mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge says:
‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘ayamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.

segments.pli: tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They have the understanding that eliminates hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’
A mendicant who makes a declaration of development says:
‘I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.

segments.pli: tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They have the understanding that eliminates hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’
A mendicant who makes a declaration of both knowledge and development says:

segments.pli: ‘jānāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, passāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, bhāvitakāyomhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño’ti.
segments.en: ‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching. And I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.

segments.pli: tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They have the understanding that eliminates hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
segments.en: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, puriso aḍḍhova samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeyya, dhanavāva samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeyya, bhogavāva samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeyya.
segments.en: Suppose a rich, affluent, and wealthy person was to declare themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.

segments.pli: So kismiñcideva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne sakkuṇeyya upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā.
segments.en: And whenever it came time to make a payment they were able to come up with the money, grain, silver, or gold.
Then they would know of them:

segments.pli: ‘aḍḍhova ayamāyasmā samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeti, dhanavāva ayamāyasmā samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeti, bhogavāva ayamāyasmā samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeti.
segments.en: ‘This person declares themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy, and they are in fact rich, affluent, and wealthy.’

segments.pli: Tathā hi ayamāyasmā kismiñcideva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne sakkoti upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā’ti.
segments.en: Because when it came time to make a payment they were able to come up with the money, grain, silver, or gold.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, ñāṇavādañca bhikkhu vadamāno bhāvanāvādañca:
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge and development says:

segments.pli: ‘jānāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, passāmimaṃ dhammaṃ, bhāvitakāyomhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño’ti.
segments.en: ‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching. And I am developed in physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.’

segments.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
segments.en: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
segments.en: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

segments.pli: ‘tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
segments.en: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.

segments.pli: tathā ayamāyasmā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
segments.en: They have the understanding that eliminates hate …

segments.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā nābhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’”ti.
segments.en: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’”

sections.title: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the…

suttaplex.blurb: Venerable Mahācunda teaches that, though a mendicant might claim to be free of greed, hate, and delusion, this is not always the case.
